metadata.title: CVE-2020-15668 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
A lock was missing when accessing a data structure and importingcertificate information into the trust database. This vulnerability affectsFirefox < 80 and Firefox for Android < 80.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15668` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 80.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 80.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 80.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '80.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
